main event: An unusual meteor sighting was reported on November 5, 1956, in Rapid City, South Dakota.
interesting points: The object was shaped like a flame from a jet afterburner and colored blue., The observed trail appeared zigzagging and was slightly bigger than a disto cannon., The object was observed for a duration of 8 to 10 seconds at a very high altitude., A sharp pull-up at the end of the observation was noted when the light went out., The sighting was classified as unidentified by the investigating authority.
sighted object: An object resembling a flame trail with an afterburner glow
witness description: The report is based on observations from individuals involved in the investigation but does not specify confirmed witnesses.
